text:
(1)
71 W. Kingsbridge Road, north side, at the N. W. corner of Reservoir Avenue, showing the Fordham Dutch Reformed Church. The edifice was built in 1848 and is the congregation's third. Virginia, wife of Edgar Allen Poe, lies buried here. The church is going to be razed early in 1940 to br replaced by a new structure. For additional data see Jenkins's Story of the Bronx, p. 275, also the "New York Times," February 16, 1940.
1911
Gift of Randall Comfort

(2)
The same, at a later date, viewing westward.
May 8, 1928
P. L. Sperr

(3)
An additional view at a still later date.
October, 1935
R. W. Hill

October, 1935
R. W. Hill

2717 Reservoir Ave., of the NW corner of West Kingsbridge Road, showing the gatekeeper's lodge on the H.B. Claflin estate. The G.W. Bromley map of 1924 as revised to September 1932, shows the site to be occupied by a 1-story garage building. The H.B. Claflin Mansion was located at what is now the SE corner of West 197th Street and Webb Ave. and was replaced by a private driveway from Reservoir Ave., commencing at the gatekeeper's lodge.

Autumn 1923.

P.L. Sperr

(1)
W. Kingsbridge Road, north side, east from Reservoir Avenue to Jerome Avenue, showing the 258th Field Artillery Armory.

P. L. Sperr

(2)
A view of the two towers at the Main entrance to the Armory, as seen from Davidson Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

2711 Reservoir Avenue, adjoining the N.W. corner of W. Kingsbridge Road, showing the 180-year-old manse of the Fordham Manor Dutch Reformed Church, shortly before it was demolished along with the church edifice. A new church and parish house will be erected here. For additional comments see "The New York Times," February 17, 1940.

February 18, 1940

Gift of Beecher Ogden

(1)

71 W. Kingsbridge Road, at the N.W. corner of Reservoir Avenue, showing the Fordham Manor Dutch Reformed Church, built in the middle of the last century. The church, together with the 150-year-old manse, is to be razed and a new edifice erected. For additional data see "The New York Times," February 17, 1940, and Jenkins's "The Story of the Bronx."

February 18, 1940

Gift of Beecher Ogden

(2)

A full view of the church, looking westward across W. Kingsbridge Road, and showing its eâst side on Reservoir Avenue.

February 18, 1940

Gift of Beecher Ogden

Gift of Beecher Ogden

71 W. Kingsbridge Road, at the N.W. corner of Reservoir Avenue. Shown are two views of the interior of the old Fordham Manor Dutch Reformed Church, shortly before the edifice was razed. The altar and organ are at the north end of the church. For additional comments see "The New York Times" of February 17, 1940.

February 18, 1940
Views 1, 2
